# Problem 2
## Initial setup (load the dataset) and create a bootstrap function
```{r}
weather_df = 
  rnoaa::meteo_pull_monitors(
    c("USW00094728"),
    var = c("PRCP", "TMIN", "TMAX"), 
    date_min = "2022-01-01",
    date_max = "2022-12-31") |>
  mutate(
    name = recode(id, USW00094728 = "CentralPark_NY"),
    tmin = tmin / 10,
    tmax = tmax / 10) |>
  select(name, id, everything())

boot_sample = function(df) {
  sample_frac(df, replace = TRUE)
}

bootboot_straps = 
  tibble(strap_number = 1:10) |> 
  mutate(
    strap_sample = map(strap_number, \(df) boot_sample(weather_df))
  )

bootboot_straps$strap_sample[[1]]
```


## Run Linear Regression to the samples and calculate the log(β̂ 1∗β̂ 2) and r̂ 2
```{r}
bootboot_straps_results =
  bootboot_straps %>% 
  mutate(
    models = map(strap_sample, \(df) lm(tmax ~ tmin + prcp, data = df)),
    results = map(models, broom::tidy),
    r_sq = map(models, broom::glance)) %>% 
  mutate(b = map_dbl(results, ~log(.x[[2]][[2]] * .x[[2]][[3]]))) %>% 
  mutate(r_sq = map(r_sq, ~ .x %>% select(r.squared))) %>% 
  select(-strap_sample, -models) %>% 
  unnest(results, r_sq) 
  

 bootboot_straps_results %>% view() 
  
  



  mutate(ci_lower = map_dbl(estimate, quantile(0.025)),
         ci_upper = map_dbl(estimate, quantile(0.975))) 


           
```
